name: @local/root
description: Root - running 'firebase-jest-testing' against a sample project.

scripts.ci:seq: firebase emulators:exec --project=bunny --config firebase.json --only firestore,functions "npm run _ci_init && npm run --silent _ci_fns && npm run --silent _ci_rules"
scripts._ci_par_2: concurrently -n test-fns,test-rules "npm run _ci_init && npm run _ci_fns" "npm run _ci_rules"
scripts.start: concurrently -n emul,init "firebase emulators:start --project=bunny --config firebase.json --only functions,firestore" "GCLOUD_PROJECT=bunny npm run _start_2"
scripts.test:fns:callables: GCLOUD_PROJECT=bunny NODE_OPTIONS="--experimental-vm-modules --experimental-json-modules" npx jest --config sample/test-fns/jest.config.js -f greet.8x.test.js --verbose --detectOpenHandles --all
scripts.postinstall: npm --prefix package install && npm --prefix sample/functions install

--experimental-vm-modules: Needed for now (Aug 2020), to use native ES6 modules with Jest
--detectOpenHandles speeds up tests: This is weird, but consistent (Jest 26). If we keep it in 'npm test', the test execution is ~2x faster (as reported, per test).
However, chose to keep it only in tests which otherwise give a warning.
bunny: If httpsCallables are among the emulated features, Cloud Functions needs a dummy project id. The value is used in
construction of the URL for the callable.
engines.node: 15.9.0..15.11 (maybe more) and Jest 27.0.0-next.3 have a love bug: https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/37426
engines.npm: >= 7.7.0 because of this (only matters for 'npm publish') -> https://github.com/npm/cli/issues/2834
